On this day: Chappell, Lillee & Rod Marsh retired together at SCG
description: On January 6, 1984, Australian cricket legends Greg Chappell, Dennis Lillee, and Rod Marsh played their final Test together at the SCG. Chappell retired as Australia's highest run-scorer, Lillee as the world's leading wicket-taker, and Marsh with a then-world record for dismissals. Their simultaneous farewell marked the end of a golden era.

title: 6,6,6,4,6,6: Bairstow unleashes carnage in Centurion; Maharaj endures costliest SA20 over
description: Jonny Bairstow produced a moment of SA20 history at Centurion, smashing Keshav Maharaj for a record 34-run over that turned the contest decisively in Sunrisers Eastern Cape’s favour. While Bairstow flirted with the rare feat of six sixes in an over, Pretoria Capitals were left to reflect on another home defeat.

title: Snow, Kangris and Pherans: How Kashmir adapts to the rhythm of Chillai Kalan — inside the 40-day spell
description: Kashmir's harshest winter period, Chillai Kalan, has arrived, transforming the valley into a snow-draped spectacle. This year, the region is experiencing a remarkable surge in tourism, with hotels fully booked and events planned across popular destinations. The season also brings vital snowfall for agriculture and refuge for migratory birds, while the Army maintains a proactive counter-terror posture.

title: Hajj 2026 shock: Why has Egypt ended free pilgrimage trips? New rules, packages introduced
description: Egypt is ending state-funded free Hajj slots for 2026, shifting to a digital lottery for approximately 12,000 pilgrims and licensed paid packages. This move reflects economic reforms and aims for transparency in managing the pilgrimage. Ordinary Egyptians will now rely on these new systems rather than government subsidies for their spiritual journey.

description: Uttar Pradesh's draft electoral roll, published after a special intensive revision, has excluded approximately 2.89 crore voters. This exclusion is due to deceased voters, those who have moved or are missing, and duplicate entries. The final voter list will be released on March 6, 2026, with voters urged to verify their details online.

description: India's economy is projected to grow by 6.9% in FY27, driven by structural reforms and trade agreements, according to India Ratings & Research. The nation anticipates a "Goldilocks" phase with strong growth and moderate inflation, averaging 3.8% for retail inflation. Government finances are also expected to improve, with Centre's debt easing to 55.5% of GDP.

title: Reliance Industries shares fall 5%! Over Rs 1 lakh cr eroded from M-cap

Despite the clarification, investor sentiment remained weak, impacting the Nifty 50.

title: 'We bitterly regret this': Swiss authorities admit inspection failure after Crans-Montana bar fire
description: Swiss local authorities admitted to a five-year lapse in safety inspections at a bar where a deadly New Year's Eve fire killed 40 people. Mayor Nicolas Feraud expressed deep regret for the oversight, stating "we bitterly regret this." Prosecutors are investigating the bar's managers following the blaze, which is believed to have been ignited by sparkling candles.

A Supreme Court ruling on broad tariffs could offer relief, but the political landscape remains complex ahead of midterms.

description: Religious tensions flared in Birgunj, Nepal, following a provocative TikTok video, leading authorities to extend an ongoing curfew.  Despite the prohibitory order, two groups held simultaneous demonstrations, prompting a full curfew with shoot-on-sight orders for security personnel. The unrest, initially sparked by a video in Dhanusha, spread rapidly, causing widespread disruption.

description: Gold prices surged on Tuesday, driven by escalating political instability in Venezuela and heightened US-Latin America tensions, prompting investors to seek safe-haven assets. February gold futures on MCX climbed by Rs 445, while international Comex futures advanced, reflecting a growing demand for the precious metal amid global uncertainties.  Local prices varied across major Indian cities.

description: Kolkata has become a vibrant hub for world chess, hosting an elite rapid and blitz tournament with roots tracing back to a Dutch steel company's initiative in 1938. This annual spectacle, now in its seventh edition, showcases top international and Indian talent, fostering a strong sporting culture and engaging a passionate audience.

Despite a slight slowdown after the holiday window, the Ranveer Singh starrer has amassed an impressive Rs 777.78 crore. This non-sequel hit now sets its sights on outperforming 'Pushpa 2' in future installments.

Kota burglary attempt fails after thief gets trapped in exhaust fan window
description: A burglary attempt in Kota took a comical turn when one of two thieves got stuck in an exhaust fan window. The homeowner spotted the trapped intruder, leading to his arrest by police. His accomplice fled the scene. Authorities recovered a car key and a suspicious vehicle, suggesting a pattern of thefts. Efforts are ongoing to nab the second suspect.

Steve Smith overtakes Don Bradman - Now behind are only Virat and Sachin
description: Australia's Steven Smith has become cricket's highest run-scorer against England, surpassing Don Bradman with his 37th Test century. This remarkable achievement places him behind only Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli in all-time international runs against a single opponent. Smith's masterclass at the SCG further solidified his dominance in the Ashes.

The actor stated that leaders who served the people live on in public memory, beyond political erasure. Chavan's remarks were made at an election rally, predicting the end of Vilasrao Deshmukh's influence in the city.

description: Tech giants, including Apple, are reportedly camping out in South Korean hotels to secure crucial memory chip supplies.  A global shortage, driven by AI demand, has sent RAM prices soaring, forcing companies to negotiate long-term contracts.  This situation could lead to higher iPhone prices or reduced memory in future models.

description: The Madras High Court has upheld a single judge's order. The Subramaniya Swamy temple management must light the Karthigai deepam at the deepathoon atop Thiruparankundram hill. The court found no valid reason to deny this practice. The stone pillar is located on Devasthanam land. The court directed the Devasthanam to comply with the order during the Karthigai festival.

description: A romantic Saturday evening turned tragic in Noida when a live-in partner allegedly stabbed his South Korean boyfriend to death after an argument over his drinking habits. The 22-year-old woman claimed self-defense after her partner threatened her. She later admitted to the stabbing, leading to her arrest and judicial custody.

title: SC: Fearless judges bedrock of judiciary, can’t be penalised for error of judgment
description: The Supreme Court ruled that judges cannot face disciplinary action for errors in judgment, emphasizing that a fearless judiciary is crucial for the rule of law. The court expressed concern over frivolous complaints against judges, which can lead to trial court judges hesitating to grant bail, and reinstated a judge terminated for an error in judgment.

title: $20,000 instead of Rs 20,000: How a typo left Kerala University poorer by Rs 16 lakh
description: A costly bank error at Kerala University's Centre for Latin American Studies resulted in a Rs 16.5 lakh loss. A typo swapped '₹' for '$' during a payment to a guest lecturer's wife, sending $20,000 instead of Rs 20,000. Efforts to recover the excess funds have failed, with the lecturer passing away before repayment.

title: Delhi man walks into police station, confesses to killing mother, 2 siblings
description: A 25-year-old man confessed to police in Delhi, claiming he drugged and strangled his mother, sister, and teenage brother. Financial stress and marital discord reportedly fueled the horrific act. The accused allegedly used sedatives from dhatura seeds mixed into prasad laddoos before committing the murders. Police are awaiting autopsy reports for confirmation.

title: 'Culprit not her ex-boyfriend': Was Hyd woman working in US murdered over money?
description: A 27-year-old Indian woman, Nikitha Godishala, was found murdered in Maryland, USA. Police are searching for Arjun Sharma, who allegedly fled to India after borrowing money from Nikitha. Her father clarified Sharma was not her ex-boyfriend but a former housemate. The incident has deeply impacted the Indian community.

title: Alex Jones mocks Candace Owens over Zodiac Killer father claim apology
description: Alex Jones mocked claims made by Candace Owens’ source, Mitch Snow, who said the Zodiac Killer was his father. Jones used sarcasm to question the lack of proof and compared the claim to seeing Martians. Authorities have never identified the Zodiac Killer, and no DNA evidence has confirmed Snow’s story.

title: Indore deaths: SDM suspended after nod to Congress stir over Kailash Vijayvargiya remarks
Delhi: 46L households paid zero electricity bill in Dec; subsidy outlay set to cross Rs 4,000 cr
description: Delhi's free electricity scheme reached over 90% of households in December 2025, with 73% paying no bill. The scheme, offering free power up to 200 units and 50% subsidy up to 400 units, saw sustained coverage, benefiting nearly 8 in 10 domestic consumers on average last year.

title: Uttarakhand: Govt mulls banning non-Hindus’ entry in 105 ghats of Haridwar; 1916 agreement in focus
description: Uttarakhand government is considering a ban on non-Hindus entering Haridwar's 105 ghats, potentially restoring a 1916 agreement. The state also plans to declare Haridwar and Rishikesh as 'holy cities'. This move follows demands from some religious leaders, though opposition exists among residents and former Ganga Sabha officials.

title: 'Donald Jennifer Trump': Jimmy Kimmel trolls president in Critics Choice win speech - watch
description: Jimmy Kimmel playfully thanked "Donald Jennifer Trump" after winning a Critics Choice Award, crediting the former president's "ridiculous things" for his show's success.  This comes after a public feud and FCC threats that ironically boosted Kimmel's ratings. He also lauded industry support for free speech.

title: Math genius Joel David Hamkins says AI models are basically useless for math tasks
description: Renowned mathematician Joel David Hamkins has voiced strong doubts about large language models' utility in mathematical research, calling their outputs "garbage" and "not mathematically correct." He highlights AI's frustrating tendency to confidently assert incorrectness and resist correction, mirroring unproductive human interactions. Despite AI's benchmark successes, Hamkins finds current systems unreliable for genuine research collaboration.

title: Sidney Crosby’s lifestyle: Inside Penguins captain’s luxury watch collection
description: Sidney Crosby is the player whom the world recognizes as one of the most impressive NHL players of his time. Other than his incredible success on the ice, Crosby has also acquired a taste for pure luxury watches. His assortment demonstrates performance, style, and an individual meaning and reveals his personality off the ice and an increasing engagement with the Swiss watch industry.
